criteria: Ability to identify emergency situations requiring 9-1-1 or adult assistance.
Understanding of the appropriate steps to take in different emergency scenarios.
Awareness of resources and how to access them in an emergency (e.g., knowing how to call 9-1-1, finding a responsible adult).
descriptions: Student does not identify any emergency situations or when to seek help.
Student identifies only one basic emergency situation.
Student identifies a few emergency situations but lacks detail on when to seek help.
Student identifies common emergency situations and generally knows when to seek help, but may miss some nuances.
Student identifies a wide range of emergency situations and provides clear guidelines on when to seek help or call 9-1-1.
Student comprehensively identifies a very wide range of emergency situations, provides nuanced guidelines on when to seek help or call 9-1-1, and articulates the importance of timely action.
Student demonstrates no understanding of steps to take in an emergency.
Student lists one or two basic actions but without context or correct order.
Student lists some actions but lacks a clear understanding of the proper sequence or priority.
Student generally understands appropriate steps but may miss critical details.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of appropriate steps to take in various emergency scenarios, including the order of actions.
Student demonstrates expert understanding of appropriate steps, including nuanced actions based on specific scenarios, and can explain the rationale behind each step.
Student is unaware of basic emergency resources like 9-1-1.
Student knows about 9-1-1 but doesn't know how to access it.
Student knows how to call 9-1-1 but is unaware of other resources.
Student knows how to call 9-1-1 and identifies one or two other relevant resources.
Student identifies multiple emergency resources and understands how to access them quickly.

Student demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of a wide range of emergency resources and can explain how to access them efficiently and effectively in various situations, including alternative methods when primary options are unavailable.
